communication.encrypted_messenger module¶

class communication.encrypted_messenger.EncryptedMessenger(role, socket)[source]¶

Bases: communication.messenger.Messenger

Handles the transmission and encryption of messages over a connection.

Parameters:
  • role – Whether the messenger should work as a server or client.
  • socket – A handle to the connection
consume_message()[source]¶

Fetches message from the connection.

Returns:A decrypted message.
consume_messages()[source]¶

Fetches all pending messages.

Returns:All decrypted messages.
perform_handshake(private_key, contact_key)[source]¶

Performs a handshake with the contact to which we’re connected.

Parameters:
  • private_key – The user’s private key.
  • contact_key – The contact’s public key.
Raises:

ValueError – This error will be raised if the messenger’s role does not exist.
perform_handshake_as_client(private_key, contact_key)[source]¶

Waits for the contact to start exchanging keys to validate their authenticity then sends the user’s.

Parameters:
  • private_key – The user’s private key.
  • contact_key – The contact’s public key.
Raises:
  • HandshakeTimeoutException – The wait will time-out if no handshake messages are received in a given period.
  • OSError – The messenger will raise this error if there are issues with the connection while attempting to receive data.
  • # TODO – Document crypter errors after I’ve documented crypter.
perform_handshake_as_server(private_key, contact_key)[source]¶

Takes the initiative in exchanging keys with the contact to start the messaging session.

Parameters:
  • private_key – The user’s private key.
  • contact_key – The contact’s public key.
Raises:
  • HandshakeTimeoutException – The wait will time-out if no handshake messages are received in a given period.
  • OSError – The messenger will raise this error if there are issues with the connection while attempting to receive data.
  • # TODO – Document crypter errors after I’ve documented crypter.
run(private_key, contact_public_key)[source]¶

Start the messaging session.

Parameters:
  • private_key – The private key of the user.
  • contact_public_key – The public of the contact with whom the user is connected.
send(message)[source]¶

Sends a message over the current connection.

Parameters:message – A unicode string of the message.
wait_for_next_message()[source]¶

Tries continuously to fetch a message until it does.

Returns:

The latest pending message.
Raises:
  • HandshakeTimeoutException – The wait will time-out if no handshake messages are received in a given period.
  • OSError – The messenger will raise this error if there are issues with the connection while attempting to receive data.
